snippet.title: Top 5 Underrated Disney Cartoons
snippet.description: As you probably know, Walt Disney's Frozen ended its eighth weekend yesterday with $317 million in domestic grosses. That makes it officially the biggest-grossing single-release Disney Studios animated film in domestic history; surpassing the $312m original theatrical gross of The Lion King in 1994 (it was of course reissued in September 2011 and [...] read »

snippet.title: Toyota Is On A Festival Tour And Ramps Up Buzz Along the Way
snippet.description: VideoToyota's SpongeBob car promotion Toyota has ended the summer on a high, as Buzz for the brand has risen since its festival-focused "Let’s Go Places" and kids-friendly "Happy Driving!" campaigns. The carmaker is currently second in terms of Purchase Consideration out of competitor brands Ford and Honda, following a duo of [...] read »

snippet.title: Ways To Express Freedom: The Third Annual International Festival Of Political Cartooning In Caen, France
snippet.description: What happens when political cartoonists from around the world gather in one place for a week and share their passion for what they do?

snippet.title: Exclusive Interview With Zack Snyder, Director Of 'Batman Vs. Superman'
snippet.description: With the Man of Steel sequel about to start shooting in Detroit, fans have been hoping new information about the movie will drop soon, and desperately awaiting the reveal of the new batsuit and Wonder Woman costume. Well, dear readers, I had a chance to speak at length with the [...] read »

snippet.title: Five Senators Demand Unconstitutional Restrictions On E-Cigarette Ads—For The Children
snippet.description: Today five senators—Barbara Boxer (D-Calif.), Richard Durbin (D-Ill.), Tom Harkin (D-Iowa), Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.), and Edward Markey (D-Mass.)—introduced “legislation to protect children from e-cigarettes." To be more precise, the bill aims to protect children from speech about e-cigarettes. The Protecting Children from Electronic Cigarette [...] read »

snippet.title: Neil Gaiman's Sandman Snuck Up On Me In San Francisco
snippet.description: From Sandman #8, drawn by Mike Dringenberg, where we first meet Morpheus' sister, Death. Image used with persmission of the Cartoon Art Museum / copyright DC Comics - Vertigo. I like my experiences with serendipity to have a touch of cosmic significance – like, was this meant to happen? I always try [...] read »

snippet.title: Andrew Revkin On Renewables, The Limits Of Information And Being In The Dangerous Middle
snippet.description: The Seattle Science Festival 2013 ended on Saturday with it's closing night program, Our 11th Hour: Straight Talk on Climate Change from People Who Know with world-leading experts on climate change: Dr. Kevin Trenberth, Dr. Richard Alley and New York Times journalist Andrew Revkin, followed by a 30-minute opera on environmental stewardship, Heron [...] read »
